entries: The totem takes the damage of an attack that would hit a creature it is attached to.
{@note} This requires the {@optfeature Totem Commander|Starlight} Primordial Rune to use.

trait.name: Nature Spirit Totem
entries: The totem cannot take any actions unless its summoner expends the appropriate action to command it to do so.

trait.name: Voltaic Totem Aura
entries: The totem emits an aura which affects a 15-foot radius sphere centred on itself.
Creatures of your choice within the area are unable to take {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB|Reactions}.

trait.name: Totemic Might
entries: Gains temporary hit points equal to twice your PB when summoned.
{@note This requires the {@optfeature Totemic Might|Starlight} Primordial Rune.}

bonus.name: Totemic Blast
entries: {@atk rs} {@hitYourSpellAttack} to hit, range 30/60 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d8+PB} damage of the type associated with your elemental affinity.
{@note} This requires the {@optfeature Totemic Blast|Starlight} Primordial Rune to use.

reaction.name: Totem Commander
entries: The totem takes the damage of an attack that would hit a creature it is attached to.
{@note} This requires the {@optfeature Totem Commander|Starlight} Primordial Rune to use.

trait.name: Nature Spirit Totem
entries: The totem cannot take any actions unless its summoner expends the appropriate action to command it to do so.

trait.name: Booming Totem Aura
entries: The totem emits an aura which affects a 15-foot radius sphere centred on itself.

At the start of your turns, the totem emits a shockwave. Each creature of your choice within the totem's area must make a Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 15 feet directly away from the totem.

trait.name: Totemic Might
entries: Gains temporary hit points equal to twice your PB when summoned.
{@note This requires the {@optfeature Totemic Might|Starlight} Primordial Rune.}

bonus.name: Totemic Blast
entries: {@atk rs} {@hitYourSpellAttack} to hit, range 30/60 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d8+PB} damage of the type associated with your elemental affinity.
{@note} This requires the {@optfeature Totemic Blast|Starlight} Primordial Rune to use.

reaction.name: Totem Commander
entries: The totem takes the damage of an attack that would hit a creature it is attached to.
{@note} This requires the {@optfeature Totem Commander|Starlight} Primordial Rune to use.

trait.name: Nature Spirit Totem
entries: The totem cannot take any actions unless its summoner expends the appropriate action to command it to do so.

trait.name: Caustic Totem Aura
entries: The totem emits an aura which affects a 15-foot radius sphere centred on itself.
Creatures of your choice within the area suffer a -2 penalty to their AC.

trait.name: Totemic Might
entries: Gains temporary hit points equal to twice your PB when summoned.
{@note This requires the {@optfeature Totemic Might|Starlight} Primordial Rune.}

bonus.name: Totemic Blast
entries: {@atk rs} {@hitYourSpellAttack} to hit, range 30/60 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d8+PB} damage of the type associated with your elemental affinity.
{@note} This requires the {@optfeature Totemic Blast|Starlight} Primordial Rune to use.

reaction.name: Totem Commander
entries: The totem takes the damage of an attack that would hit a creature it is attached to.
{@note} This requires the {@optfeature Totem Commander|Starlight} Primordial Rune to use.

condition.name: Dazed
entries: While you have the Dazed condition, you experience the following effects.

entries.name: Movement Affected
entries: Your movement speed is {@condition Slowed|Starlight}.

entries.name: Actions Affected
entries: On your turn you can take either an {@variantrule Action|XPHB} or {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, but not both.
If you become dazed during your turn, this takes effect retroactively: if you have used only your Action or Bonus Action, you cannot take the other.

condition.name: Disoriented
entries: While you have the Disoriented condition, you experience the following effects.

entries.name: Movement Affected
entries: Your movement is {@condition Hampered|Starlight}.

entries.name: Ability Checks Affected
entries: You have disadvantage on Wisdom and Intelligence {@variantrule Ability Check|XPHB|ability checks}.

entries.name: Attacks and Saves Affected
entries: You can make only one attack whenever you attack using an {@variantrule Action|XPHB} or {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, and you cannot cast spells higher than first level.

condition.name: Overwhelmed
entries: While you have the Overwhelmed condition, you experience the following effects.

entries.name: Actions and Movement Prevented
entries: An overwhelmed creature is {@condition incapacitated} and {@condition halted|Starlight}.

entries.name: Attacks Affected
entries: Attacks against you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB}.

entries.name: Saving Throws Affected
entries: You automatically fail Strength and Dexterity {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB|saving throws}.

entries.name: Ending the Condition
entries: The condition can be ended on a creature if another creature spends an Action or Bonus Action to help them recover.

condition.name: Weakened
entries: While you have the Weakened condition, you experience the following effects.

entries.name: Attacks Affected
entries: You deal half damage with effects that require an attack roll.

entries.name: Saving Throws Affected
entries: If an effect does not require an attack roll, targets instead have advantage on any saving throw or ability check made to resist it.

condition.name: Off-balance
entries: While you have the Off-balance condition, you experience the following effects.

entries.name: Attacks Affected
entries: Attacks against you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB}, and your attacks have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB}.

entries.name: Saving Throws Affected
entries: You have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on any checks or saving throws you make to avoid being forcibly moved or falling {@condition Prone}.

entries.name: Ending the Condition
entries: The condition ends when you take damage, or you miss an attack roll.

condition.name: Exposed
entries: While you have the Exposed condition, you experience the following effects.

entries.name: Attacks Affected
entries: Successful attacks against an exposed creature count as a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB}.

condition.name: Marked
entries: While you have the Marked condition, you experience the following effects.

entries.name: Attacks Affected
entries: Attack rolls against you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} if the attacker can see you.

condition.name: Silenced
entries: While you have the Silenced condition, you experience the following effects.

entries.name: Spells and Speech Affected
entries: A silenced creature cannot speak, or cast spells requiring verbal components.

condition.name: Sundered
entries: While you have the Sundered condition, you experience the following effects.

entries.name: Defense Affected
entries: The creature's armour class cannot benefit from armour or shields, but still gains any special bonuses to AC that those items offer (such as a +1 shield). If the armour would limit the creature's Dexterity modifier bonus to armour class (such as Half-Plate or Plate armour) or impose disadvantage on Stealth (Dexterity) checks, it still does.

condition.name: Staggered
entries: While you have the Staggered condition, you experience the following effects.

entries.name: Defense Affected
entries: Your Dexterity modifier cannot increase your {@variantrule Armor Class|XPHB|Armour Class}.

condition.name: Bleeding
entries: While you have the Bleeding condition, you experience the following effects.

entries.name: Damage Received
entries: You take 3 slashing damage at the start of each of your turns.

entries.name: Saving Throws Affected
entries: You have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on Constitution saving throws.

entries.name: Ending the Condition
entries: You can use an {@variantrule Action|XPHB} to attempt a DC 10 {@skill Medicine} check to stop the bleeding.
Regaining any hit points also ends the condition.
If you are immune to slashing damage, you are immune to this condition. If you are resistant to slashing damage, you have advantage on any saving throws against the condition instead.

condition.name: Burning
entries: While you have the Burning condition, you experience the following effects.

entries.name: Damage Received
entries: You take {@dice 1d4} fire damage at the start of each of your turns.

entries.name: Actions Affected
entries: You cannot use a free time-limited object interaction, you must use the {@action Utilize|XPHB|Utilise} action to interact with objects (such as drawing a weapon or opening doors).

entries.name: Ending the Condition
entries: You can use an {@variantrule Action|XPHB} to attempt a DC 10 {@skill Medicine} check to stop the burning.
If you are immune to fire damage, you are immune to this condition. If you are resistant to fire damage, you have advantage on any saving throws against the condition instead.

condition.name: Shocked
entries: While you have the Shocked condition, you experience the following effects.

entries.name: Reactions Affected
entries: You regain one fewer {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} than you normally would at the start of your turns.

entries.name: Saving Throws Affected
entries: You have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on Dexterity saving throws.

entries.name: Ending the Condition
entries: If you are immune to Lightning damage, you are immune to this condition. If you are resistant to lightning damage, you have advantage on any saving throws against the condition instead.

condition.name: Melting
entries: While you have the Melting condition, you experience the following effects.

entries.name: Defense Affected
entries: Your {@variantrule Armor Class|XPHB|Armour Class} is reduced by 1 at the start of each of your turns. It is restored when this condition ends.

entries.name: Ending the Condition
entries: You or a nearby creature can use an {@variantrule Action|XPHB} to clear the acid or other substance causing the condition, if there is one.
If you are immune to acid damage, you are immune to this condition. If you are resistant to acid damage, you have advantage on any saving throws against the condition instead.

condition.name: Brittle
entries: While you have the Hampered condition, you experience the following effects.

entries.name: Restricted Movement
entries: Your movement is {@condition Hampered}.

entries.name: Damage Increased
entries: When you take any damage, that damage is increased by {@dice 1d4}.

entries.name: Ending the Condition
entries: The condition ends after you take fire damage.
If you are immune to cold damage, you are immune to this condition. If you are resistant to cold damage, you have advantage on any saving throws against the condition instead.

condition.name: Hampered
entries: While you have the Hampered condition, you experience the following effects.

entries.name: Restricted Movement
entries: Your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is reduced by 10 feet.

entries.name: Multiple Penalties
entries: You can be Hampered more than once, increasing the speed penalty, but not from the same source.

condition.name: Slowed
entries: While you have the Slowed condition, you experience the following effects.

entries.name: Restricted Movement
entries: Your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is halved.

condition.name: Sluggish
entries: While you have the Sluggish condition, you experience the following effects.

entries.name: Restricted Movement
entries: Your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is reduced to 10 feet.

condition.name: Halted
entries: While you have the Halted condition, you experience the following effects.

entries.name: Restricted Movement
entries: Your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is 0 and cannot increase.

items: If you start your turn while Dying, you roll a {@variantrule Death Saving Throw|XPHB}. Regaining any hit points ends this condition on you. Being stabilised via a DC 10 Wisdom (Medicine) check prevents only the death saving throw rolls.
You are prone and cannot get up.
On your turn, you can move, or take an action or a bonus action. Taking an action gives two levels of exhaustion, bonus actions and reactions give one.

condition.name: Spell Power
entries: While you have the Spell Power condition, you experience the following effects.

entries.name: Spells Affected
entries: You deal increased damage with your spells. Whenever you roll damage for a spell, add your Spell Power to the damage roll.
{@note The increase depends on the source of the condition. This could be denoted as "Spell Power (X)".}

item.name: Necklace of Bitter Tears
entries: Whenever you regain hit points while wearing this necklace, your weapon attacks before the end of your next turn deal an additional {@dice 1d6} poison damage.

item.name: Bracers of Extreme Evocation
entries: Whenever you cast a spell, you can select the relevant option from the following list in order to roll an additional {@dice 2d6} damage when determining the spell's damage. If a spell requires multiple attack rolls, this applies to all of them.

items: If the spell requires an attack roll, take a -5 penalty to that roll.
If it requires a saving throw, targets have advantage on that saving throw.

item.name: Gloves of Benign Transposition
entries: When you hit or affect a willing creature with an attack or spell using Dexterity, Intelligence, Wisdom or Charisma, you may swap places with them.

item.name: Gloves of Malicious Transposition
entries: These gloves have 3 charges, which are restored when you complete a long rest. When you hit or affect a creature with an attack or spell, you may expend a charge to swap places with them. An unwilling creature may make a DC 15 Charisma saving throw to avoid the effect.

item.name: Ring of Mana Channeling
entries: While concentrating, your weapon attacks deal 2 additional damage of the weapon's type.

entries.name: Attunement
entries: The additional damage is force, and equal to your spellcasting ability modifier instead of 2.

item.name: Ring of Protection
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to saving throws while wearing this ring.

entries.name: Attunement
entries: and +1 to AC.

item.name: Cloak of Protection
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to saving throws while wearing this cloak.

entries.name: Attunement
entries: and +1 to AC.

item.name: A Promise Made
entries: This ring shares a single charge with {@item A Promise Kept|Starlight}, which recovers when you complete a long rest.
The wearer can expend the charge to cast {@spell Unshakeable Tail|J:Portalist}, {@spell Warding Bond|phb}, or {@spell Sanctuary|phb} on the bearer of A Promise Kept.

item.name: A Promise Kept
entries: This ring shares a single charge with {@item A Promise Made|Starlight}, which recovers each when you complete a long rest.
The wearer can expend the charge to cast {@spell Unshakeable Tail|J:Portalist}, {@spell Warding Bond|phb}, or {@spell Sanctuary|phb} on the bearer of A Promise Made.

item.name: Circlet of Storytelling
entries: Stories you tell gain a subtle effect to make them more compelling.
You have advantage on Charisma (Performance) checks, and can conjure small images of the tales you tell in the form of blurred cloudy images above your head.

item.name: Astral Teardrop
entries: You can fail an additional death saving throw before dying (4 total).

entries.name: Attunement
entries: You cannot be possessed or mind controlled. Once per long rest, you can cast {@spell Enervation|xge} or {@spell Modify Memory|phb}. If cast in this way, Modify Memory can affect a memory of any age, but only once on a given target.

item.name: Fate's Pendant
entries: A sphere filled with shifting colours. When seen in your peripheral, it resembles an eye watching you.

entries.name: Redirect Fate.
entries: Once each long rest, you may reroll any attack, ability check, or saving throw that you make, using the new result.

entries.name: Attunement
entries: The Pendant carries {@dice 1d4-1} charges, which can be used to cast the {@spell Wish|phb} spell.
Additionally, when you use Redirect Fate, roll {@dice 4d6}. You may restore that many hit points, or deal that much necrotic damage, to a creature of your choice that you can see.

item.name: Soulful Rook Chesspiece
entries: This appears to be a normal chesspiece, except that the floor of the rook's battlements glows slightly.
You may teleport up to 90 feet in any cardinal direction. You may not teleport past any creature in those directions.

Additionally, the next attack you make this turn after teleporting, on a hit, forces the target to make a DC 13 Strength saving throw. On a failure, they are moved 10 feet in a direction of your choice.
You may use this ability only if you haven't moved this turn, and you are {@condition Halted|Starlight} until the end of your turn when you use it.
Once the piece has been used this way, you cannot use it again until you complete a long rest, during which time the piece stops glowing.

item.name: Soulful Queen Chesspiece
entries: This appears to be a normal chesspiece, except that the queen's crown glows slightly.
You may teleport up to 90 feet in any ordinal or cardinal direction. You may not teleport past any creature in those directions.

Additionally, the next attack you make this turn after teleporting, on a hit, forces the target to make a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, they are {@condition Frightened|phb} of you until the start of your next turn.
You may use this ability only if you haven't moved this turn, and you are {@condition Halted|Starlight} until the end of your turn when you use it.
Once the piece has been used this way, you cannot use it again until you complete a long rest, during which time the piece stops glowing.

item.name: Soulful Bishop Chesspiece
entries: This appears to be a normal chesspiece, except that the bishop's mitre glows slightly.
You may teleport up to 90 feet in any ordinal direction. You may not teleport past any creature in those directions.

Additionally, you roll an additional {@dice 1d6} when determinig the damage of the next attack you make this turn after teleporting. This attack can restore hit points, instead of dealing damage, if you choose.
You may use this ability only if you haven't moved this turn, and you are {@condition Halted|Starlight} until the end of your turn when you use it.
Once the piece has been used this way, you cannot use it again until you complete a long rest, during which time the piece stops glowing.

item.name: Soulful Knight Chesspiece
entries: This appears to be a normal chesspiece, except that the floor of the rook's battlements glows slightly.
You may teleport up to 60 feet in any direction except the cardinal or ordinal ones.
Additionally, the next attack you make this turn after teleporting, on a hit, {@condition Hampered|Starlight|Hampers} your target's movement until the start of your next turn.
You may use this ability only if you haven't moved this turn, and you are {@condition Halted|Starlight} until the end of your turn when you use it.
Once the piece has been used this way, you cannot use it again until you complete a long rest, during which time the piece stops glowing.

item.name: Quickstep Boots
entries: When you take the dodge action while wearing these boots, you can immediately move 5 feet without provoking opportunity attacks.

item.name: Eye of the 10-eyed Wyrm
entries: One of the eyes of the mighty Dreaad Serpent Anach-Tal'lul. merely possessing it grants the bearer one of His many powers. Such powers can be difficult to handle, however, and this imposes limitations on mortals using them.

entries.name: Attunement
entries: The eye has two charges, which recover when you complete a long rest. As an action, you can expend one charge to grant yourself one benefit from the table, and its associated detriment, for one hour.

rows: You gain advantage on initiative checks.
On your first turn in combat, you are {@condition Slowed|Starlight}.
You gain advantage on Wisdom ability checks.
You gain disadvantage on Intelligence ability checks.
You gain advantage on all attacks.
You gain disadvantage on all saving throws.
You gain resistance to bludgeoning, piercing and slashing damage.
You gain vulnerablity to fire, cold, and lightning damage.

item.name: Blessed Circlet
entries: You receive {@dice 1d4} (additional) hitpoints when you are healed with a spell, or when you heal others with a spell.

item.name: Career Student's Ring
entries: While wearing this ring, you can add half of your proficiency bonus to any any skill in which you are not already proficient.
{@note This does not combine with the Bard's 'Jack of All Trades' feature, or other similar features.}

item.name: Forgotten Green Hood
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to Dexterity (Stealth or Sleight of Hand) checks.
You cannot be targeted by Divination magic or perceived through magical means, such as a Scrying sensor or looking through a familiar's eyes.

item.name: Friend of Arcanists
entries: You have a +1 bonus to Intelligence (Arcana) and Intelligence (History) checks.

entries.name: Attunement
entries: The bonus is a +2 instead.

item.name: Friend of Druids
entries: You have a +1 bonus to Intelligence (Nature) and Wisdom (Animal Handling) checks.

entries.name: Attunement
entries: The bonus is a +2 instead.

item.name: Friend of Priests
entries: You have a +1 bonus to Intelligence (Religion) and Wisdom (Medicine) checks.

entries.name: Attunement
entries: The bonus is a +2 instead.

item.name: Friend of Warriors
entries: You have a +1 bonus to Strength (Athletics) and Charisma (Intimidation) checks.

entries.name: Attunement
entries: The bonus is a +2 instead.

item.name: Friend of Parties
entries: You have a +1 bonus to Charisma (Persuasion) and Charisma (Performance) checks.

entries.name: Attunement
entries: The bonus is a +2 instead.

item.name: Friend of Thieves
entries: You have a +1 bonus to Dexterity (Sleight of Hand) and Intelligence (Investigation) checks.

entries.name: Attunement
entries: The bonus is a +2 instead.

item.name: Friend of Urchins
entries: You have a +1 bonus to Wisdom (Survival) and Wisdom (Perception) checks.

entries.name: Attunement
entries: The bonus is a +2 instead.

item.name: Friend of the Paranoid
entries: You have a +1 bonus to Charisma (Deception) and Wisdom (Insight) checks.

entries.name: Attunement
entries: The bonus is a +2 instead.

item.name: Friend of Light-foots
entries: You have a +1 bonus to Dexterity (Stealth) and Dexterity (Acrobatics) checks.

entries.name: Attunement
entries: The bonus is a +2 instead.

item.name: Hunter's Shawl
entries: While wearing this cloak, if you kill a creature, you gain temporary hit points equal to its CR or level.

item.name: Hunter's Hood
entries: You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks made to spot creatures who are hiding from you.

entries.name: Attunement
entries: You can cast the {@spell Hunter's Mark|phb} spell at 3rd level. A creature marked in this way takes the additional damage from {@b all} weapon attacks, not just yours. Once you do so, the spell cannot be cast this way until you complete a long rest.

item.name: Hunter's Boots
entries: You have advantage on ability checks and saving throws made to escape being {@condition Grappled|phb|grappled} or {@condition Restrained|phb|restrained.}

item.name: Hunter's Bracers
entries: Hostile creatures within 5 feet of you do not impose disadvantage on your ranged attacks.

item.name: Hunter's Ring
entries: You gain a {@dice 1d4} bonus to attack rolls made against creatures who are under the effects of {@spell Guiding Bolt|phb}, {@spell Hunter's Mark|phb}, {@spell Faerie Fire|phb}, or the {@classFeature Favoured Foe|Ranger|phb|1|tce} feature.

item.name: Moon-Touched Bracelet
entries: You have resistance to radiant damage while you are wearing this ring.

entries.name: Attunement
entries: You can store one spell of up to 3rd level within the bracelet. Any creature can cast a spell of 1st through 3rd level into the bracelet by touching the bracelet as the spell is cast. The spell's effect is then stored for later use.

While wearing the bracelet, you can cast the spell stored in it; the spell uses the same level as when it was cast, as well as the spell save DC, attack bonus and spellcasting ablity of the original caster, but is otherwise treated as if you had cast it. Once cast, the spell is removed from the bracelet, freeing up the space.

item.name: Ring of Borrowed Time
entries: If you have the {@condition Dying|Starlight} condition at the start of your turn, you instead enter a new state where you borrow time from your own potential future.
Instead of rolling a death saving throw at the start of your turns, you fail your death saving throw automatically at the end of your turns, but can otherwise act without penality.
This ends when the dying condition would. After the ring has put you into this alternate state, once you leave that state, the ring loses its magic until you complete a long rest.

item.name: Cloak of the Timekeeper
entries: Attacks that deal force damage have disadvantage against you, and you have advantage on any saving throw against an effect that would cause you to take force damage on a success or failure.

item.name: Stopped-clock Circlet
entries: As a reaction, you can halt an effect or spell that targets an area that you can see. Before the end of your next turn, you can release the effect (no action required) at its original target space.
Once used, this cannot be used again until you complete a long rest.

entries.name: Attunement
entries: You can choose to {@status concentration||concentrate} on the effect (as if you were {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell) in order to choose a new target point from the effect when you release it (as if it originated from you). It still uses the original statistics.

item.name: Time-knife Gloves
entries: Whenever you hit a creature with an attack roll while wearing these gloves, it loses a reaction, if it has at least one.

item.name: Boots of Excellent Positioning
entries: These boots have 5 charges which are recovered upon completing a long rest. Whenever you are moved against your will, you can expend a reaction and one charge to teleport to any space you occupied after the start of your previous turn.

entries.name: Attunement
entries: You can use the reaction and expend a charge at any time, instead of only when you are moved against your will.

entries.name: Attunement
entries: While in combat, you regain {@dice 1d4} hit points at the start of each of your turns.

item.name: Amulet of Unmitigated Gall
entries: Anyone wearing this amulet cannot have disadvantage on Charisma ability checks.
The wearer has a +1 bonus to Charisma (Persuasion) and Charisma (Deception) checks.

item.name: Cloak of the Profane Elf
entries: {@b Hellish Rebuke.} Creatures that hit you with a melee attack become {@condition Burning|Starlight} until the end of their next turn.

item.name: Cloak of Arcane Bolstering
entries: Gain temporary hit points equal to your spellcasting modifier when you cast a spell while within 5 feet of a hostile creature.

item.name: Cloak of the Wind
entries: Your movement speed is increased by 5 feet.

entries.name: Attunement
entries: Your movement speed is increased by 10 feet instead.

item.name: Apathetic Cloak
entries: This cloak foils spells cast to determine your thoughts and intentions (such as {@spell Detect Thoughts|PHB} or {@spell Zone of Truth|PHB}), and grants you advantage on Intelligence saving throws.

item.name: Sanctuary Rose Cutting
entries: This pale blue rose petal glows dimly within its jar, emitting 5 feet of dim light at all times and is surrounded by floating motes of light, which occasionally hit the glass.

While holding the jar, as a bonus action on your turn or as a reaction when you take damage that doesn't reduce you to 0 hit points, you can shatter the jar and release its magic to protect yourself. This reduces your current hit points to 1, and until the end of your next turn you are immune to all damage and effects that would move you against your will, and are under the effects of the {@spell Antilife Shell} spell for that duration.

item.name: Sanctuary Rose
entries: This pale blue rose glows dimly, emitting 10 feet of dim light at all times and is surrounded by floating motes of light.

While holding the rose, on your turn (no action required) or as a reaction when you take damage that doesn't reduce you to 0 hit points, you can channel its magic to protect yourself. This reduces your current hit points to 1, and until the end of your next turn you are immune to all damage and effects that would move you against your will, and are under the effects of the {@spell Antilife Shell} spell for that duration.
Once this effect is used, the Rose must spend an hour in direct moonlight (under any moonphase except for new) before it can be used again.

item.name: Darkmoon Dhalia
entries: This dark purple flower emits a faint mist of dim light when held, suppressing any other light sources within a 30 foot radius and replacing that light with dim light.
Any creatures who take necrotic damage while in this dim light take an additional {@dice 1d6} necrotic damage.

item.name: Chalice of Light
entries: Once each day, this chalice can be used to pour out a vial's worth of {@item Holy Water (flask)|PHB|holy water}. This holy water becomes mundane water when the Chalice is used again.
As an action, the holy water can be drank to end the {@condition poisoned|PHB} condition or one disease afflicting the character.

Over the course of one minute, this vial can also be used to coat a weapon, granting it a +1 bonus to attack rolls and +1 radiant damage against fiends and undead. The coating lasts for one hour and for the duration the weapon is considered magical for the purposes of overcoming resistances.

item.name: Coin of Future Problems
entries: Once per day, you can hold onto this coin and hope for a little extra luck (no action required). You gain advantage on a roll (attack, ability check, or saving throw) when you do so. The next roll you make after that has disadvantage.

item.name: Arrow of Acid

entries.name: Magic Ammunition
entries: This magic ammunition gains a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls. It is destroyed on use, dealing the weapon's ordinary damage (unless otherwise specified) and the additional effect below.

On hit, this ammunition explodes, dealing {@dice 2d4} acid damage to all creatures within 10 feet of the target. The target must make a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC or have its AC reduced by 2 until the start of your next turn.

item.name: Arrow of Fire

entries.name: Magic Ammunition
entries: This magic ammunition gains a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls. It is destroyed on use, dealing the weapon's ordinary damage (unless otherwise specified) and the additional effect below.

On hit, this ammunition explodees, dealing {@dice 2d4} fire damage to all creatures within 10 feet of the target. The target must make a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC or become {@condition Burning|Starlight|burning}, repeating the saving throw at the end of each of its turns to end the effect.

item.name: Arrow of Ice

entries.name: Magic Ammunition
entries: This magic ammunition gains a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls. It is destroyed on use, dealing the weapon's ordinary damage (unless otherwise specified) and the additional effect below.

On hit, this ammunition explodes, dealing {@dice 2d4} cold damage to all creatures within 10 feet of the target. The target's movement speed is {@condition Hampered|Starlight|hampered} until the start of your next turn.

item.name: Arrow of Lightning

entries.name: Magic Ammunition
entries: This magic ammunition gains a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls. It is destroyed on use, dealing the weapon's ordinary damage (unless otherwise specified) and the additional effect below.

On hit, this ammunition explodes, dealing {@dice 2d4} lightning damage to all creatures within 10 feet of the target. The target must make a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC or lose one reaction.

item.name: Arrow of Thunder

entries.name: Magic Ammunition
entries: This magic ammunition gains a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls. It is destroyed on use, dealing the weapon's ordinary damage (unless otherwise specified) and the additional effect below.

On hit, this ammunition explodes, forcing all creatures within 10 feet of the target to make a Strength saving throw against your spell save DC or be thrown 10 feet away from the target (the target is pushed directly away from you.
Huge or larger creatures have advantage on this saving throw.

item.name: Arrow of Gravity

entries.name: Magic Ammunition
entries: This magic ammunition gains a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls. It is destroyed on use, dealing the weapon's ordinary damage (unless otherwise specified) and the additional effect below.

On hit, the ammunition explodes, and all creatures within 15 feet of the target must make a Strength saving throw or be pulled up to 10 feet towards the target. If they cannot be moved the full 10 feet, they fall {@condition prone|phb} as well. On a failed save, the target is pulled towards you.

item.name: Arrow of Piercing

entries.name: Magic Ammunition
entries: This magic ammunition gains a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls. It is destroyed on use, dealing the weapon's ordinary damage (unless otherwise specified) and the additional effect below.
On hit, the arrow deals half the damage of the original hit to a creature no further than 10 feet behind the original target.

item.name: Arrow of Wounding

entries.name: Magic Ammunition
entries: This magic ammunition gains a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls. It is destroyed on use, dealing the weapon's ordinary damage (unless otherwise specified) and the additional effect below.
On hit, causes the target to {@condition bleeding|Starlight|bleed}. If they move on their next turn, they gain two stacks of {@condition bleeding|Starlight}.

item.name: Arrow of Maiming

entries.name: Magic Ammunition
entries: This magic ammunition gains a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls. It is destroyed on use, dealing the weapon's ordinary damage (unless otherwise specified) and the additional effect below.
On hit, the target must make a Constitution saving throw or become {@condition halted|Starlight}. On a successful saving throw, they are {@condition slowed|Starlight} instead.

item.name: Arrow of Curing

entries.name: Magic Ammunition
entries: This magic ammunition gains a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls. It is destroyed on use, dealing the weapon's ordinary damage (unless otherwise specified) and the additional effect below.

On hit, this ammunition deals no damage, and instead clears the targets of any of the following conditions: {@condition blinded|phb}, {@condition poisoned|phb}, {@condition paralysed|phb}, {@condition deafened|phb}, {@condition dazed|Starlight}, {@condition disoriented|Starlight}, {@condition weakened|Starlight}, {@condition bleeding|Starlight}, {@condition burning|Starlight}, or {@condition shocked|Starlight}.

item.name: Arrow of Disruption

entries.name: Magic Ammunition
entries: This magic ammunition gains a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls. It is destroyed on use, dealing the weapon's ordinary damage (unless otherwise specified) and the additional effect below.

On hit, the target loses concentration on any spell they are maintaining. Additionally, they must make a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC or become {@condition Silenced|Starlight} until the end of their next turn.

item.name: Arrow of Darkness

entries.name: Magic Ammunition
entries: This magic ammunition gains a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls. It is destroyed on use, dealing the weapon's ordinary damage (unless otherwise specified) and the additional effect below.
On hit, you cast the {@spell Darkness|phb} spell on the target or target location. It lasts the full duration, not requiring concentration.

item.name: Arrow of Lesser Slaying

entries.name: Magic Ammunition
entries: This magic ammunition gains a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls. It is destroyed on use, dealing the weapon's ordinary damage (unless otherwise specified) and the additional effect below.
If this arrow hits a Beast, Monstrosity, Undead, Humanoid, Construct, or Aberration, the attack is a critical hit.

item.name: Arrow of Weeping

entries.name: Magic Ammunition
entries: This magic ammunition gains a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls. It is destroyed on use, dealing the weapon's ordinary damage (unless otherwise specified) and the additional effect below.
On hit, the target takes an additional {@dice 1d4} necrotic damage and cannot regain any hit points until the start of your next turn.

item.name: Arrow of Greater Slaying

entries.name: Magic Ammunition
entries: This magic ammunition gains a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls. It is destroyed on use, dealing the weapon's ordinary damage (unless otherwise specified) and the additional effect below.
If this arrow hits a Dragon, Celestial, Elemental, Fiend, or Fey, the attack is a critical hit.

item.name: Arrow of Recurving

entries.name: Magic Ammunition
entries: This magic ammunition gains a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls. It is destroyed on use, dealing the weapon's ordinary damage (unless otherwise specified) and the additional effect below.
Hit or miss, you may make an additional attack roll against up to 3 nearby targets within 30 feet of the original. You do not add your ability modifier to the damage roll of this attack.

item.name: Arrow of Relocation

entries.name: Magic Ammunition
entries: This magic ammunition gains a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls. It is destroyed on use, dealing the weapon's ordinary damage (unless otherwise specified) and the additional effect below.
You teleport to where this arrow lands.

item.name: Arrow of Explosives

entries.name: Magic Ammunition
entries: This magic ammunition gains a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls. It is destroyed on use, dealing the weapon's ordinary damage (unless otherwise specified) and the additional effect below.

Hit or miss, this arrow explodes, forcing all creatures within 10 feet of the target to make a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed saving throw, they take {@dice 4d4} fire damage and {@dice 4d4} force damage. On a successful saving throw, they take half the damage.

item.name: Nature's Emissary
entries: You have +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon.

entries.name: Attunement
entries: As an action or in place of an attack when you take the {@action Attack} action, you can plant this sword in the ground to cause a special effect within a radius of 15 feet. You can change the benefit upon completing a long rest - which may alter its appearance.

Nature's Emissary stores a reservoir of energy with points equal to five times your character level. The reservoir is replenished each long rest. A benefit that requires the drawing of energy cannot be done without the required points.

entries.name: Spring's Rain
entries: The radius is filled with cool air a soothing mist. If a creature ends their turn within the radius, you may grant it up to 5 hit points, taking that many points from the reservoir.

entries.name: Fall's Warding
entries: The radius is filled with swirling leaves. Creatures within the area gain the benefit of half cover. This effect drains 5 points from the reservoir for each round it is planted there..

entries.name: Summer's Glory
entries: The radius is filled with warm air and bright light. If a creature starts its turn within the area, you may spend up to five points from the reservoir, increasing its movement speed by five times the number of points spent until the end of its turn. Additionally, you can spend five points and a reaction to grant a creature within the radius advantage on a saving throw it makes.

entries.name: Winter's Watch
entries: The radius becomes cold, and filled with dim light. Creatures within the area take less damage and healing from all sources, of an amount equal to your proficiency bonus. This effect drains 5 points from the reservoir for each round it is planted there.
You can pick up the sword as if it were lying on the floor to be picked up. Unattuned creatures must spend an action to do so.

item.name: Protector's Naginata
entries: This weapon is a polearm.
This weapon places you in the position of a corageous leader in battle. You have advantage on saving throws against the {@condition Frightened|phb} condition while wielding this weapon.

entries.name: Attunement
entries: When you kill a creature with this weapon, you can treat this as a +1 weapon against other creatures of its type. When the weapon is unattuned, it loses its memory.

{@note At the DM's discretion, 'of its type' may refer to species in the case of humanoids, drawing a distinction between elves, humanoids, dwarves, and so on. However, it is suggested that they be lenient, as this is just a +1 weapon.}

item.name: Sentinel's Rapier
entries: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls using this weapon.
You gain a +1 bonus to initiative rolls.
While in combat, you deal an additional {@dice 1d6} necrotic damage with this weapon against creatures who have not taken a turn yet.

item.name: Jagged Followthrough
entries: You gain a {@dice 1d4} bonus to attack and damage rolls with this weapon when you attack a target that is {@condition Bleeding|S: Conditions}.

entries.name: Attunement
entries: Once per short rest, you can make a special attack with this weapon that causes targets to {@condition Bleeding|S: Conditions|bleed} twice on hit. This can be used as an action, or in place of a normal weapon attack.

item.name: Threadsplitter
entries: You have a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls using this weapon.

entries.name: Wrath of Time
entries: This weapon deals an additional {@dice 1d4} force damage on each attack.

entries.name: Threadsplitter
entries: When you attack with advantage, if both rolls would hit the target, you roll the weapon's damage one additional time when determining the attack's damage. If you critically hit, this means that you roll the dice three times, not four.

entries.name: Eyes of Temporus
entries: You can cast the {@spell True Seeing|phb} spell once using this weapon. You regain the ability to do so after completing a long rest.

item.name: Clovehoof Armour
entries: Made from unusual fey materials, this armour is very light while still offering incredible protection. However, it is not more subtle than other similar armours.
You can add your full Dexterity modifier to your AC when wearing this medium armour.

item.name: Dragonspirit Robes
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to the attack and damage rolls of your unarmed strikes.

entries.name: Attunement
entries: Your Ki save DC increases by 1, and once per long rest you may spent an action to regain a number of ki points equal to your wisdom modifier.

item.name: Vest of the Optimist
entries: You have a +2 bonus to AC while wearing this armour.
{@b All} creatures within 10 feet of you, including yourself, have vulnerability to piercing damage.

item.name: Timeless Scale-mail
entries: This scale-mail is made of the actual dragonscales of Temporus the Timekeeper, a time dragon.
You have +1 bonus to AC while wearing this armour, and you can add 3, rather than 2, to your AC if you have a Dexterity score of 16 or higher.

entries.name: Clarity
entries: You have advantage on any saving throw against the {@condition Dazed|Starlight} or {@condition Disoriented|Starlight} conditions.

entries.name: Immutable
entries: You gain a {@dice 1d4} bonus to all saving throws while wearing this armour.

entries.name: Echoes in time
entries: You can sense which, if any, dragons were within 30 miles of your location within the last year.
